[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/incentive_v2.move] [Function: create_and_transfer_owner()] [Authorization Bypass] Can an attacker who compromises StorageOwnerCap create unlimited OwnerCap objects and distribute them to malicious actors, allowing permanent admin control even after the original owner is revoked? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/incentive_v2.move] [Function: create_funds_pool()] [Authorization Bypass] If OwnerCap is stolen or leaked, can attacker create malicious funds pools with manipulated oracle_id that return incorrect prices, enabling reward inflation when claiming? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/incentive_v2.move] [Function: add_funds()] [Authorization Check] Does OwnerCap requirement prevent malicious users from directly calling add_funds with minimal value and causing IncreasedFunds events that could confuse off-chain monitoring systems? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/incentive_v2.move] [Function: withdraw_funds()] [Fund Custody] Can OwnerCap holder drain all funds from IncentiveFundsPool even when active incentive pools still require those funds for distribution, causing reward claims to fail? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/incentive_v2.move] [Function: version_migrate()] [Version Control] Can attacker front-run version_migrate() to perform actions on old version before migration completes, then exploit version-specific vulnerabilities that were supposed to be patched? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/incentive_v2.move] [Function: create_incentive_pool()] [Parameter Validation] Can owner create incentive pool with start_at=0 and end_at=0, bypassing the duration check at line 217, causing division by zero in calculate_release_rate()? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/incentive_v2.move] [Function: create_funds_pool()] [State Consistency] When force=true parameter is used, does the function properly handle existing funds pools with same type T, or could it create duplicate entries in incentive.funds table causing accounting confusion? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/incentive_v2.move] [Function: create_funds_pool()] [Oracle Manipulation] Can attacker create funds pool with oracle_id pointing to a manipulated or non-existent oracle, then later use this pool for incentive distribution with incorrect price feeds? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/incentive_v2.move] [Function: add_funds()] [Accounting Error] At line 158, balance::join() returns the new total, but could precision loss occur when adding very small amounts repeatedly, causing balance tracking mismatch? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/incentive_v2.move] [Function: add_funds()] [Overflow Risk] If attacker adds funds near u64::MAX limit, could balance::join() cause overflow that wraps around, allowing attacker to drain funds by exploiting underflowed balance? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/incentive_v2.move] [Function: withdraw_funds()] [Insufficient Balance Check] Line 168 checks balance >= value, but what if multiple concurrent withdraw_funds calls pass this check simultaneously before balance is updated, causing double-spend? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/incentive_v2.move] [Function: withdraw_funds()] [Reentrancy] After balance::split() at line 171 but before transfer at line 174, could reentrant call to withdraw_funds occur if T is a malicious coin type with custom transfer hooks? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/incentive_v2.move] [Function: create_incentive_pool()] [Time Validation] Line 217-218 validates start_at < end_at and closed_at timing, but what if start_at is far in the future (e.g., year 3000), could this lock funds indefinitely? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/incentive_v2.move] [Function: create_incentive_pool()] [Supply Overflow] If total_supply parameter at line 211 is set to u64::MAX (18446744073709551615), could reward calculations at line 460 overflow when converted to u256? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/incentive_v2.move] [Function: create_incentive_pool()] [Factor Validation] Factor parameter at line 214 is u256 with no upper bound check; can attacker create pool with factor=u256::MAX causing overflow in calculate_user_effective_amount() at line 477? [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/incentive_v2.move] [Function: create_incentive_pool()] [Asset ID Validation] No validation that asset_id at line 213 corresponds to actual asset in storage; could invalid asset_id cause get_user_balance() to return zero, preventing any rewards? [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/incentive_v2.move] [Function: create_incentive_pool()] [Option Validation] Option parameter at line 212 is u8 with no bounds check; could invalid option values (>4) cause undefined behavior in calculate_user_effective_amount()? [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/incentive_v2.move] [Function: create_incentive_pool()] [Phase Collision] Phase parameter at line 207 has no uniqueness check; could duplicate phases cause freeze_incentive_pool() to incorrectly categorize active pools as inactive? [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/incentive_v2.move] [Function: create_incentive_pool()] [Funds Pool Validation] Line 225 stores funds pool address but doesn't verify IncentiveFundsPool<T> type matches; could type mismatch cause claim_reward to fail when casting funds_pool? [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/incentive_v2.move] [Function: create_incentive_pool()] [Initial State] last_update_at initialized to start_at at line 236, but if clock::timestamp_ms() < start_at when update_reward is called, could negative time_diff cause underflow? [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/incentive_v2.move] [Function: create_incentive_pool()] [Table Initialization] Three separate tables created at lines 237-239, but no atomicity guarantee; could partial creation leave inconsistent state if transaction aborts? [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/incentive_v2.move] [Function: create_incentive_pool()] [Duplicate Pool] No check prevents creating multiple pools with identical (phase, start_at, end_at, asset_id, option) parameters; could duplicate pools cause double-reward distribution? [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/incentive_v2.move] [Function: freeze_incentive_pool()] [Deadline Manipulation] At line 259, pools with phase < deadline are frozen, but if deadline=0, all pools become inactive; can this be used to DOS all reward claims? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/incentive_v2.move] [Function: freeze_incentive_pool()] [Vector Reordering] Lines 256-266 iterate backwards through pool_objs and rebuild vectors; could this change ordering affect get_pool_from_asset_and_option() results and break reward distribution? [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/incentive_v2.move] [Function: freeze_incentive_pool()] [Partial Freeze] If freeze_incentive_pool() aborts mid-execution at line 265, could pool_objs be partially cleared while inactive_objs is partially populated, creating inconsistent state?
